description: Univerbation of pin +â€Ž afore. The pinafore was originally pinned to the front of a dress, as it had no buttons.

entries.meaning: A sleeveless dress, often similar to an apron, generally worn over other clothes, and most often worn by young girls as an overdress.

verbs.description: pinafore (third-person singular simple present pinafores, present participle pinaforing, simple past and past participle pinafored)
